Description: Pottery hydria with a small flared foot, ridged convex sides, a single spout, two strap-handles, a straight neck and an everted rim; the shoulder is decorated with floral vine scrolls in black and red paint. Egyptian marl fabric with calcaric inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Curator's comments: Cf., from Kellia (Egloff 1977, no. 199, pl. 63.2). Egloff, M. 1977. Kellia: La poterie copte: Quatre siècles d’artisanat et d’échanges en Basse-Égypte. Recherches suisses d’archéologie copte. Genève: Georg.
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (1)
